required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Buprenorphine Transdermal System (BTDS) in Subjects w/Mod-sev Osteoarthritis (OA) Chronic Pain of Knee
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled With Open-label Run-in Assessing Efficacy, Tolerability,Safety of BTDS 10 or 20 Compared to Placebo in Opioid-naïve Subjects w/Moderate to Severe, Chronic Pain Due to OA of Knee

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to determine the analgesic efficacy and safety of Buprenorphine Transdermal System (BTDS) 10 and 20 compared to placebo in opioid-naïve subjects with moderate to severe chronic pain due to osteoarthritis (OA) of the knee. The double-blind treatment intervention duration is 12 weeks, during which time supplemental analgesic medication (immediate-release oxycodone for the first 6 days postrandomization and acetaminophen or ibuprofen for the remainder of the double-blind phase) will be provided to all subjects in addition to study drug.

detailed_description.textblock: Buprenorphine is a synthetic opioid analgesic with over 25 years of international clinical experience indicating it to be safe and effective in a variety of therapeutic settings for the relief of moderate to severe pain. BTDS is a transdermal system formulation that is designed to deliver a consistent and a steady dose of buprenorphine over a 7-day period with limited blood concentration fluctuation.

primary_outcome.measure: "Average Pain Over the Last 24 Hours" Score of the Study Knee at Week 12 of the Double Blind Phase.
primary_outcome.description: "Average pain over the last 24 hours" scores of the study knee at week 12 was evaluated on an 11-point scale: 0 = no pain, 10 = worst pain imaginable, recorded daily.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Daily Number of Tablets of Nonopioid Supplemental Analgesic Used From Week 2 to 12 of the Double-blind Phase.
secondary_outcome.description: Subjects were permitted to take sponsor-provided supplemental analgesic medication after week 1 of the double-blind treatment (acetaminophen or ibuprofen).

secondary_outcome.measure: Sleep Disturbance Subscale of the MOS-Sleep Scale at Weeks 4, 8, and 12 of the Double-blind Phase.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Weeks 4, 8, and 12 of the double-bind phase
secondary_outcome.description: The MOS Sleep Scale consists of 12 individual items (4 sleep disturbance, 2 sleep adequacy, 1 quantity of sleep and optimal sleep, 3 somnolence, 1 snoring, and 1 shortness of breath) and takes 5 to 10 minutes to complete. Question 1 is scored on a scale of 1 to 5 ( 1 = 0-15 min to more than 60 min) and Questions 2 to 12 are scored on a scale of 1 to 6 (1 = all of the time to 6 = none of the time. The Sleep Disturbance Subscale score is derived from the scores to Questions 1, 3, 7, and 8 and ranges from 0 to 100, where higher scores indicate greater sleep disturbance.

arm_group.description: Buprenorphine transdermal system 10 and 20 applied for 7-day wear
Placebo transdermal system to match BTDS patches, applied for 7-day wear

intervention.description: transdermal system 10 and 20 applied for 7-day wear

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- subjects with moderate to severe chronic osteoarthritis (OA) pain of the knee (lasting several hours daily) as their predominant pain condition,
- clinical diagnosis of OA of the knee 1 year or longer,
- subjects treated within the 14 days prior to screening with nonopioid therapy only, or with therapy including opioids at a dose of < 5 mg oxycodone (or equivalent) per day,
- subjects whose OA knee pain is not adequately controlled with nonopioid analgesic medication and who the investigator feels are appropriate candidates for around-the-clock opioid therapy.
Exclusion Criteria:
- subjects who have had arthroscopy on either knee or hip within 6 months of entering the study or open surgery on either knee or hip within 9 months of entering the study,
- subjects who are allergic to buprenorphine or who have a history of allergies to other opioids,
- subjects who have allergies or other contraindications to transdermal delivery systems or patch adhesives.
Other protocol-specific inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply.

facility.name: New England Center for Clinical Research

participant_flow.recruitment_details: 27-Sep-2007 (first patient first visit) to 28-Apr-2009 (last patient last visit) at 83 medical/research sites in US
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Open-label run-in period designed to select those subjects who both tolerated and responded to treatment with BTDS 10 or BTDS 20 (an enriched design). N = 1151 entered the run-in period, and N = 571 completed. One subject was not dosed, therefore N = 570 randomized. N = 3 subjects did not have safety data, therefore N = 567 had double-blind data.

group.title: Double-blind BTDS 10 or 20
group.description: Buprenorphine transdermal patches (BTDS) 10 or 20 mcg/h applied for 7-day wear

group.title: Double-blind Placebo
group.description: Placebo patches to match the BTDS patches applied for 7-day wear

group.description: Buprenorphine transdermal patches (BTDS) 10 or 20 mcg/h applied for 7-day wear

group.description: Placebo patches to match the BTDS patches applied for 7-day wear

outcome.title: "Average Pain Over the Last 24 Hours" Score of the Study Knee at Week 12 of the Double Blind Phase.
outcome.description: "Average pain over the last 24 hours” scores of the study knee at week 12 was evaluated on an 11-point scale: 0 = no pain, 10 = worst pain imaginable, recorded daily.
outcome.population: The full analysis population is the group of subjects who were randomized and received at least 1 dose of double-blind study drug

group.title: Double-blind BTDS 10 or 20
group.description: Buprenorphine transdermal patches (BTDS) 10 or 20 mcg/h applied for 7-day wear

measure.title: "Average Pain Over the Last 24 Hours" Score of the Study Knee at Week 12 of the Double Blind Phase.
measure.description: "Average pain over the last 24 hours” scores of the study knee at week 12 was evaluated on an 11-point scale: 0 = no pain, 10 = worst pain imaginable, recorded daily.

analysis.groups_desc: [Week 12 analysis] The null hypothesis was “no group differences.” The alternative hypothesis was that BTDS arm was superior to the placebo arm. Pain scale is 11 points (0 = no pain to 10 = pain as bad as you can imagine).
analysis.method_desc: Statistics are based on a mixed effect general linear model

outcome.title: Mean Daily Number of Tablets of Nonopioid Supplemental Analgesic Used From Week 2 to 12 of the Double-blind Phase.
outcome.description: Subjects were permitted to take sponsor-provided supplemental analgesic medication after week 1 of the double-blind treatment (acetaminophen or ibuprofen).
outcome.population: Subjects in the full analysis population who took at least 1 dose of supplemental analgesic medication.

group.title: Double-blind BTDS 10 or 20
group.description: Buprenorphine transdermal patches (BTDS) 10 or 20 mcg/h applied for 7-day wear

group.title: Double-blind Placebo
group.description: Placebo patches to match the BTDS patches applied for 7-day wear

measure.title: Mean Daily Number of Tablets of Nonopioid Supplemental Analgesic Used From Week 2 to 12 of the Double-blind Phase.
measure.description: Subjects were permitted to take sponsor-provided supplemental analgesic medication after week 1 of the double-blind treatment (acetaminophen or ibuprofen).
measure.population: Subjects in the full analysis population who took at least 1 dose of supplemental analgesic medication.

analysis.groups_desc: Categorical analysis P value is based on a Fisher's exact test. Mean daily number of tablets for subjects who took <=1 dose of supplemental analgesia
analysis.p_value_desc: To control multiplicity and family-wise error rate, a gate-keeping strategy (stepwise approach) was used to evaluate the statistical significance of the secondary variables. If the primary is negative, the secondary P values are descriptive only.
analysis.method_desc: with treatment as a factor and screening and pre-randomization mean pain as covariates.

outcome.title: Sleep Disturbance Subscale of the MOS-Sleep Scale at Weeks 4, 8, and 12 of the Double-blind Phase.
outcome.description: The MOS Sleep Scale consists of 12 individual items (4 sleep disturbance, 2 sleep adequacy, 1 quantity of sleep and optimal sleep, 3 somnolence, 1 snoring, and 1 shortness of breath) and takes 5 to 10 minutes to complete. Question 1 is scored on a scale of 1 to 5 ( 1 = 0-15 min to more than 60 min) and Questions 2 to 12 are scored on a scale of 1 to 6 (1 = all of the time to 6 = none of the time. The Sleep Disturbance Subscale score is derived from the scores to Questions 1, 3, 7, and 8 and ranges from 0 to 100, where higher scores indicate greater sleep disturbance.
outcome.time_frame: Weeks 4, 8, and 12 of the double-bind phase
outcome.population: Full Analysis Population (N = 570) consisted of subjects who were randomized and received at least 1 dose of double-blind study drug.

group.title: Double-blind BTDS 10 or 20
group.description: Buprenorphine transdermal patches (BTDS) 10 or 20 mcg/h applied for 7-day wear

group.title: Double-blind Placebo
group.description: Placebo patches to match the BTDS patches applied for 7-day wear

measure.title: Sleep Disturbance Subscale of the MOS-Sleep Scale at Weeks 4, 8, and 12 of the Double-blind Phase.
measure.description: The MOS Sleep Scale consists of 12 individual items (4 sleep disturbance, 2 sleep adequacy, 1 quantity of sleep and optimal sleep, 3 somnolence, 1 snoring, and 1 shortness of breath) and takes 5 to 10 minutes to complete. Question 1 is scored on a scale of 1 to 5 ( 1 = 0-15 min to more than 60 min) and Questions 2 to 12 are scored on a scale of 1 to 6 (1 = all of the time to 6 = none of the time. The Sleep Disturbance Subscale score is derived from the scores to Questions 1, 3, 7, and 8 and ranges from 0 to 100, where higher scores indicate greater sleep disturbance.
measure.population: Full Analysis Population (N = 570) consisted of subjects who were randomized and received at least 1 dose of double-blind study drug.

analysis.groups_desc: Weeks 4, 8, 12 analysis The sleep disturbance subscale was analyzed using the mixed effect linear model with fixed effects for treatment (BTDS or placebo) and time (weeks 1, 2, 4, 8, 12) as categorical, screening mean and prerandomization mean value as covariates, and subject as a random effect.
analysis.p_value_desc: To control multiplicity and family-wise error rate, a gate-keeping strategy (stepwise approach) was used to evaluate the statistical significance of the secondary variables. If the primary is negative, the secondary P values are descriptive only.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse Events (AEs) that occurred after the signing of the informed consent up to end of study and 7 days after discontinuation; or Serious AEs occurring up to 30 days following the last study visit were followed until resolution or for up to 30 days.
reported_events.desc: AEs were obtained through spontaneous reports and subject interview.

group.title: Double-blind BTDS
group.description: Buprenorphine transdermal patches (BTDS) 10 or 20 mcg/h applied for 7-day wear

group.title: Double-blind Placebo
group.description: Placebo patches to match the BTDS patches applied for 7-day wear

group.title: Open-label Run-in Period
group.description: The open-label run-in period was designed with duration of time sufficient to select those subjects who both tolerated and responded to treatment with BTDS 10 or BTDS 20 (an enriched design). During this period, subjects were required to discontinue use of all nonstudy drugs used for the treatment of chronic pain and no supplemental analgesic medications were allowed. Subjects who did not tolerate BTDS 5 were discontinued from the study.

event.description: Systematic and nonsystematic assessment One subject experienced bradycardia poststudy
Systematic and nonsystematic assessments One subject experienced acute myocardial infarction poststudy

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
